item.title: Cait add a quote by Adrienne Rich
item.description: "Re-vision – the act of looking back, of seeing with fresh eyes, of entering an old text from a new critical direction – is for woman more than a chapter in cultural history: it is an act of survival. Until we understand the assumptions in which we are drenched we cannot know ourselves. And this drive to self-knowledge, for women, is more than a search for identity: it is part of our refusal of the self-destructiveness of male-dominated society." -- Adrienne Rich

item.title: Cait add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "I tell them that if they will occupy themselves with the study of mathematics they will find in it the best remedy against the lusts of the flesh." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Cait add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Cait add a quote by Barry Gehm
item.description: "Any technology distinguishable from magic is insufficiently advanced." -- Barry Gehm

item.title: Cait add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Cait add a quote by Arthur Ransome
item.description: "Who would wave a flag to be rescued if they had a desert island of their own? That was the thing that spoilt <u>Robinson Crusoe</u>. In the end he came home. There never ought to be an end." -- Arthur Ransome

item.title: Cait add a quote by Don Marquis
item.description:
"From 'the lesson of the moth':
and before i could argue him out of his philosophy he went and immolated himself on a patent cigar lighter i do not agree with him myself i would rather have half the happiness and twice the longevity
but at the same time i wish there was something i wanted as badly as he wanted to fry himself" -- Don Marquis

item.title: Cait add a quote by Susan Cooper
item.description: "Too many!' James shouted, and slammed the door behind him." -- Susan Cooper

item.title: Cait add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Cait add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "There was a boy called Eustace Clarence Scrubb, and he almost deserved it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Cait add a quote by Naomi Novik
Cait add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Cait add a quote by Steven Brust
item.description: "Everybody generalizes from one example. At least, I do." -- Steven Brust

item.title: Cait add a quote by voltaire
item.description: "Le mieux est l'ennemi du bien. (The perfect is the enemy of the good.)" -- voltaire

item.title: Cait add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "One Christmas was so much like another, in those years around the sea-town corner now and out of all sound except the distant speaking of the voices I sometimes hear a moment before sleep, that I can never remember whether it snowed for six days and six nights when I was twelve or whether it snowed for twelve days and twelve nights when I was six." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Cait add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "Cigars should be like onions," she said, unfastening the catch and pushing back the pane. "Either the whole company does, or the whole company does not." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Cait add a quote by Francois Mauriac
item.description: "If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads." -- Francois Mauriac

item.title: Cait add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Cait add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Those of us who are blamed when old for reading childish books were blamed when children for reading books too old for us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Cait add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop." -- Lewis Carroll
